  14. (**************************************************************************)

  16. (** MD5 message digest.

  18.    This module provides functions to compute 128-bit 'digests' of
  19.    arbitrary-length strings or files. The algorithm used is MD5.

  21.    The MD5 hash function is not cryptographically secure.
  22.    Hence, this module should not be used for security-sensitive
  23.    applications.  More recent, stronger cryptographic primitives
  24.    should be used instead.
  25. *)

  27. ‌type t = string
  28. (** The type of digests: 16-character strings. *)

  30. ‌val compare : t -> t -> int
  31. (** The comparison function for 16-character digest, with the same
  32.     specification as {!Stdlib.compare} and the implementation
  33.     shared with {!String.compare}. Along with the type [t], this
  34.     function [compare] allows the module [Digest] to be passed as
  35.     argument to the functors {!Set.Make} and {!Map.Make}.
  36.     @since 4.00 *)

  38. ‌val equal : t -> t -> bool
  39. (** The equal function for 16-character digest.
  40.     @since 4.03 *)

  42. ‌val string : string -> t
  43. (** Return the digest of the given string. *)

  45. ‌val bytes : bytes -> t
  46. (** Return the digest of the given byte sequence.
  47.     @since 4.02 *)

  49. ‌val substring : string -> int -> int -> t
  50. (** [Digest.substring s ofs len] returns the digest of the substring
  51.    of [s] starting at index [ofs] and containing [len] characters. *)

  53. ‌val subbytes : bytes -> int -> int -> t
  54. (** [Digest.subbytes s ofs len] returns the digest of the subsequence
  55.     of [s] starting at index [ofs] and containing [len] bytes.
  56.     @since 4.02 *)

  58. external channel : in_channel -> int -> t = "caml_md5_chan"
  59. (** If [len] is nonnegative, [Digest.channel ic len] reads [len]
  60.    characters from channel [ic] and returns their digest, or raises
  61.    [End_of_file] if end-of-file is reached before [len] characters
  62.    are read.  If [len] is negative, [Digest.channel ic len] reads
  63.    all characters from [ic] until end-of-file is reached and return
  64.    their digest. *)

  66. val file : string -> t
  67. (** Return the digest of the file whose name is given. *)

  69. val output : out_channel -> t -> unit
  70. (** Write a digest on the given output channel. *)

  72. val input : in_channel -> t
  73. (** Read a digest from the given input channel. *)

  75. val to_hex : t -> string
  76. (** Return the printable hexadecimal representation of the given digest.
  77.     @raise Invalid_argument if the argument is not exactly 16 bytes.
  78. *)

  80. val from_hex : string -> t
  81. (** Convert a hexadecimal representation back into the corresponding digest.
  82.     @raise Invalid_argument if the argument is not exactly 32 hexadecimal
  83.    characters.
  84.    @since 4.00 *)
